base_note.note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY PROCEDURE NOTE

Date: 2025-03-07
Patient: Maria Garcia
MRN: 5517703
DOB: 07/22/1968 (56 years old)

Attending Physician: Dr. Samuel Johnson, MD
Location: Community Medical Center, Denver, CO

INDICATION: Diffuse bilateral reticular opacities on CT chest, clinical concern for hypersensitivity pneumonitis vs. idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. Pulmonary function shows restrictive pattern with DLCO 52% predicted.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Interstitial lung disease, undefined

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Same (pending pathology)

PROCEDURE: 
1. Flexible bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage
2. Fluoroscopic-guided transbronchial lung biopsy, right lower lobe
3. Fluoroscopic-guided transbronchial lung biopsy, left lower lobe

ANESTHESIA: Moderate sedation (Midazolam 4mg, Fentanyl 100mcg)

PROCEDURE DETAILS:
Following IV sedation with continuous monitoring, flexible bronchoscope (Olympus BF-1TH190) advanced through the oropharynx. Vocal cords normal, trachea patent. All segmental bronchi visualized and appeared normal with no endobronchial lesions.

AIRWAY INSPECTION: Complete inspection of airways to subsegmental level bilaterally. No mucosal abnormalities, masses, or obstruction.

BAL: Performed in the right middle lobe (RB4) using 3 x 60mL aliquots of sterile saline. Return approximately 90mL of slightly cloudy fluid. Sent for cell count with differential, cultures (bacterial, fungal, AFB), and cytology.

TRANSBRONCHIAL BIOPSIES:
Using fluoroscopic guidance (C-arm positioned for AP view), the bronchoscope was advanced into the right lower lobe basal segments. The forceps (2.0mm alligator-type) were advanced under fluoroscopic visualization, positioning the forceps approximately 1-2cm from the pleural surface. 6 transbronchial biopsies were obtained from RB9 and RB10.

The bronchoscope was then repositioned to the left lower lobe. Under fluoroscopy, 5 transbronchial biopsies were obtained from the left lower lobe (LB9-10), again positioning 1-2cm from the pleura.

After biopsies, the biopsy sites were irrigated with cold saline. Bleeding was minimal and self-limited. Final bronchoscopic inspection showed no significant bleeding or airway abnormality.

FLUOROSCOPY TIME: 2.3 minutes
RADIATION DOSE: 38 mGy·cm²

SPECIMENS:
- BAL: Cytology, cell count with diff, bacterial/fungal/AFB culture
- TBLB RLL (6 specimens): Surgical pathology
- TBLB LLL (5 specimens): Surgical pathology

COMPLICATIONS: None. No pneumothorax on post-procedure CXR.

EBL: <10mL

DISPOSITION: Recovery in PACU x 2 hours. Post-procedure CXR negative for pneumothorax. Discharge home with standard bronchoscopy precautions.

FOLLOW-UP: Return to clinic in 1 week for pathology results. If non-diagnostic, will discuss transbronchial cryobiopsy vs. surgical lung biopsy.

Samuel Johnson, MD
Pulmonary & Critical Care Medicine

evidence.primary_indication: Diffuse bilateral reticular opacities - ILD workup

code_rationales.31628: Transbronchial lung biopsy, first lobe (RLL) - 6 specimens obtained under fluoroscopic guidance.
code_rationales.31632: Transbronchial lung biopsy, additional lobe (LLL) - 5 specimens. Add-on code for second lobe.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Standard fluoroscopic-guided TBLB without navigation platform. This is conventional TBLB, distinct from navigational bronchoscopy. No radial EBUS or navigation add-ons applicable.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), each additional lobe (add-on)
Bronchoscopy; with bronchoalveolar lavage

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31628, +31632, 31624; total_work_rvu=7.18, total_rvu=11.31 (facility).

variations.note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Anthony Gonzalez
Medical Record Number: 4534202
Date of Birth: 07/22/1969
Age at Procedure: 55 years
Procedure Date: 2024-01-24

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with interstitial lung disease evaluation. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Transbronchial Biopsy:
Transbronchial lung parenchymal sampling was performed utilizing standard forceps technique with fluoroscopic localization to minimize pneumothorax risk. 
Bal:
Bronchoalveolar lavage was performed in standardized fashion with sequential aliquot instillation and aspiration to optimize cellular yield. 

INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
Detailed airway examination was performed with findings as documented in the procedural narrative.


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 31628, 31632, 31624

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

INDICATION:
Interstitial lung disease evaluation

CONSENT:
Informed consent obtained. Risks, benefits, and alternatives discussed.
Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to proceed.

TIMEOUT:
Performed. Correct patient, procedure, and site confirmed.

Moderate

- BAL: Cytology, cell count with diff, bacterial/fungal/AFB culture
- TBLB RLL (6 specimens): Surgical pathology
- TBLB LLL (5 specimens): Surgical pathology

None

Minimal

Outpatient discharge

I was present for the entire procedure and agree with the above documentation.
[Attending Signature]

variations.note_text:
On 2025-03-30, Heather Taylor, a 61-year-old patient (MRN 6060797), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for Interstitial lung disease evaluation. The patient received Moderate and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included transbronchial biopsy for tissue sampling, and bronchoalveolar lavage for microbiological and cytological analysis. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. The visualized airways appeared patent without significant abnormality. Abnormal findings were noted as described in detail above. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is ild - pending. 

Procedural coding: 31628, 31632, 31624.
